hackathon-description-text: is a space in which developers, entrepreneurs, designers, professors, researchers and persons interested in making their city a better place can gather to build in a collaboratively fashion a solution that makes our city more efficient and intelligent.
hackathon-eligibility: (It is just a guide of what the judges are looking for, you can customize it or create your own!)
hackathon-requirements:
The objective of Smart Cities Hackathon 2.0 is to encourage participants into building innovative solutions for smarter cities through a rapid pace development. Therefore, an

: The best application developed using IBM Bluemix in any of the challenges will win $1K USD!

Develop an application that solves logistics challenges tracking the merchandise from/to port of destination, security of goods, GPS live tracking, information about drivers, routes, estimated arrival time, etc. For example: an Uber-like application for manufacturing logistics
: Develop a web/mobile application that addresses a Health Challenge
: Develop a web/mobile application that makes Guadalajara a more efficient, smarter city

hackathon-rules:
The project video with more likes + shares in Facebook will win a 
!!

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The team that build their solution using IBM Bluemix and demonstrates the best and most innovative use in any of the categories will be awarded with $1,000 dlls in awards!!
The best project under the Smart Manufacturing and Logistics Challenge will win $2K in awards!!
The project video with more likes + shares in Facebook will be given $1,000 dollars in cash sponsored by IEEE Young Professionals!!
The best projectunder the Smart Health Challenge will win $500 dlls sponsored by Medisist
The winner project addressing a general Smart Cities challenge will win $1,000 dlls!
